studies.title: In Praise of Shadows
studies.finding: Classic essay on Japanese aesthetics arguing that shadow and darkness are essential to creating depth and beauty in architecture, contrasting with Western preferences for brightness - widely cited in architectural theory but is philosophical rather than empirical research

examples.location: Church of the Light, Ibaraki, Osaka, Japan
examples.description: Tadao Ando's 1989 church uses a cruciform slit in concrete walls to create dramatic light/shadow contrast. Widely documented in architectural literature as exemplar of shadow-focused design
examples.source: Widely published - verify via Tadao Ando monographs or Pritzker Prize documentation

examples.description: The oculus creates a moving beam of light that creates shadow play throughout the day - historical example of deliberate shadow design from 126 AD

examples.location: Louis Kahn buildings (Salk Institute, Kimbell Art Museum)
examples.description: Kahn's architecture is documented as using precise shadow and light relationships - his quotes on light and architecture are well-documented
